page.title: 08RAILWAYS IN ROADE
page.content: ROADE STATION WAS OPENED IN 1851 BY THE LONDON -NORTH-WESTERN-RAILWAY COMPANY.TWO MORE LINES WERE LATER ADDED TO MAKE THE NORTHAMPTON LOOP. THE STATION WAS CLOSED IN 1964 AND THE LAST TRAIN TO STOP WAS ON SUNDAY 6TH SEPTEMBER.IT WAS CLOSED BECAUSE BRITSH RAIL WANTED TO SAVE MONEY. IN 1984 THE PARISH COUNCIL AND A GROUP OF VILLAGERS TRIED TO GET IT RE-OPENED.THEY THINK IT WOULD BE MORE USEFUL NOW BECAUSE THERE ARE MORE PEOPLE IN ROADE. SOME PEOPLE STILL THINK IT WOULDN'T BE USEFUL BECAUSE MOST PEOPLE HAVE CARS NOW. AT THE MOMENT BRITSH RAIL AND THE COUNCIL ARE STILL DECIDING WHO WILL PAY FOR THE STATION IF IT IS RE-BUILT. ( BY CLARE MARTIN AGE 10 )
